body.p:
To His Excellency
Gov. Thos E Bramlette
Governor

The undersigned would respectfully represent, that R W Sharp of Bath County, kept a grocery in the town of Bethel in said County, and that he had no license to retail spirituous liquors, but that some Federal Soldiers came to his grocery in the year 1864 & demanded whisky. He told them he could not sell by the drink, and they, by threats of violence, forced him to sell in that way. And that an enemy of his presented him to the Grand jury of the County, which indicted him and the Court fined him Seventy five dollars. Mr Sharp is a poor man & now labors on a farm to support his little family. Therefore your petitioners would humbly pray your Excellency to remit said fine, & thus relieve one who is unable to pay.

Chas Whaley
T Bumfield
James MCcue
Oliver Lander
Geo Lane
I am informed that the above petition is true
